fields.Title: A combined fourth-order compact scheme with an accelerated multigrid method for the energy equation in spherical polar coordinates
fields.Description/Abstract:
This paper is devoted to numerical simulations using a higher-order compact scheme with an accelerated multigrid method for a forced convective heat transfer problem of a heated sphere immersed in a viscous, incompressible, electrically conducting fluid in the presence of an external magnetic field. The authors introduce a numerical algorithm to solve the energy equation formulated in spherical polar coordinates. The numerical algorithm is based on fourth-order nite difference schemes that result in algebraic systems, which are then solved by accelerated multigrid techniques. Fourth-order forward nite differences are applied to compute the local Nusselt number $Nu$ and the mean Nusselt number $N_m$ and the computed values are compared with recent experimental results. A degradation of the heat transfer is observed for low values of the interaction parameter $N$ while its increase is observed for high values of $N$. The efficiency of the algorithm introduced is illustrated by a sequence of numerical experiments with different Reynolds and Prandtl numbers.
